Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters

Class Multicaster

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Broadcaster, MessageTransceiver, Transceiver, Receiver, Transmitter, Nameable, NamedObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseRepeater, BroadcastingProgressReporter
public class Multicaster extends Object implements Broadcaster
A multicaster is a broadcaster which can have more than one listener. As with any broadcaster, listeners can be added to a multicaster with Broadcaster.addListener(Listener) and can be cleared with clearListeners(). MessageTransceiver can be broadcast to all listeners with transmit(Transmittable).

If a class is already extending some other base class (and since Java does not support mix-ins) an instance of Multicaster can be aggregated and its methods delegated to implement the Broadcaster interface This is not automatic in Java, but requires a minimal amount of code: 

 public class A extends B implements Repeater<Message>
 {
     private final BaseRepeater<Message> repeater = new BaseRepeater<>();

     public void broadcast(Message message)
     {
         this.repeater.broadcast(message);
     }

     public void addListener(Listener<Message> listener)
     {
         this.repeater.addListener(listener);
     }

     public void clearListeners()
     {
         this.repeater.clearListeners();
     }

     public boolean hasListeners()
     {
         return this.repeater.hasListeners();
     }
 }
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

  • Method Details

    • addListener

      public void addListener(Listener listener, Filter<Transmittable> filter)
      Adds a listener to this broadcaster that wants to receive future messages. This is the mirror method of Listener.listenTo(Broadcaster) as both methods achieve the same thing.

      Note: adding the same listener two or more times will not replace the original listener. To do that, call Broadcaster.clearListeners() before calling this method

      Specified by:
      addListener in interface Broadcaster
      Parameters:
      listener - Listener to broadcast to. Implementations should ignore null listeners.
      filter - The filter to apply

    • clearListeners

      Removes all listeners from this broadcaster
